birth_place.zh-cn: 湖南省常德府桃源县仙瑞乡上坊村湘冲
birth_place.en: Xiangchong, Shangfang Village, Xianrui Township, Taoyuan County, Changde Prefecture, Hunan Province

death_place.zh-cn: 江苏省沪海道上海县闸北区沪宁铁路医院
death_place.en: Huning Railway Hospital, Zhabei District, Shanghai County, Huhai Dao, Jiangsu Province

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，中华民国初期第一位倡导责任内阁制的政治家，华兴会和同盟会的主要领导人，国民党的主要筹建人。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary, the first politician to advocate for a cabinet responsibility system in the early Republic of China, a key leader of the Huaxinghui and the Tongmenghui, and a principal founder of the Kuomintang.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一任正式大总统，被广泛认为是刺杀宋教仁的幕后主使。
description.en: The first formal President of the Republic of China, widely considered to be the mastermind behind the assassination of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命的伟大先行者，中国同盟会的创建者，曾与宋教仁在政治路线上存在分歧。
description.en: A great pioneer of the modern democratic revolution in China, founder of the Tongmenghui, who had political disagreements with Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 中国近代民主革命家，华兴会会长，宋教仁的挚友。
description.en: A Chinese modern democratic revolutionary, president of the Huaxinghui, and a close friend of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 时任中华民国国务总理，被认为是直接布置暗杀宋教仁的执行者。
description.en: Then Premier of the Republic of China, considered to be the direct organizer of Song Jiaoren's assassination.

description.zh-cn: 中国同盟会重要成员，同盟会中部总会的筹建者之一。部分观点认为他也是刺杀宋教仁的嫌疑人之一。
description.en: An important member of the Tongmenghui and one of the founders of its Central China Branch. Some theories also suggest he was a suspect in the assassination of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 赵秉钧的秘书，通过电报“毁宋酬勋”直接安排了刺杀行动。
description.en: Secretary to Zhao Bingjun, who directly arranged the assassination through the telegram 'destroy Song for a reward'.

description.zh-cn: 中华国民共进会会长，负责雇佣凶手武士英执行对宋教仁的暗杀。
description.en: President of the China National Progressive Association, responsible for hiring the assassin Wu Shiying to carry out the assassination of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 刺杀宋教仁的直接凶手。
description.en: The direct assassin of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 同盟会女会员及女权运动领袖，因国民党党纲中无“男女平权”而与宋教仁发生冲突。
description.en: A female member of the Tongmenghui and a leader of the women's rights movement, who clashed with Song Jiaoren over the absence of 'gender equality' in the Kuomintang's platform.

description.zh-cn: 由黄兴、宋教仁等人在长沙成立的革命团体，后并入中国同盟会。
description.en: A revolutionary group founded in Changsha by Huang Xing, Song Jiaoren, and others, which later merged into the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山在日本东京成立的革命政党，由华兴会等多个革命团体合并而成。
description.en: A revolutionary party founded by Sun Yat-sen in Tokyo, Japan, formed by the merger of several revolutionary groups including the Huaxinghui.

description.zh-cn: 由宋教仁主导，将中国同盟会改组并联合其他党派而成的政党，在1913年国会选举中获胜。
description.en: A political party led by Song Jiaoren, formed by reorganizing the Tongmenghui and uniting with other parties, which won the 1913 parliamentary election.

description.zh-cn: 一种政治制度，主张内阁由国会多数党领袖组成并对国会负责。宋教仁是其在民国初期的主要倡导者。
description.en: A political system where the cabinet is formed by the leader of the majority party in parliament and is responsible to the parliament. Song Jiaoren was its main advocate in the early Republic of China.

description.zh-cn: 1913年3月20日，宋教仁在上海北站遇刺，并于22日不治身亡。此事件是二次革命的直接导火索。
description.en: On March 20, 1913, Song Jiaoren was assassinated at Shanghai North Railway Station and died on the 22nd. This event was the direct trigger for the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 由孙中山领导的反对袁世凯的武装斗争，因宋教仁遇刺案而爆发。
description.en: An armed struggle led by Sun Yat-sen against Yuan Shikai, which broke out following the assassination of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国第一届内阁，由唐绍仪组阁，宋教仁在其中担任农林总长。
description.en: The first cabinet of the Republic of China, formed by Tang Shaoyi, in which Song Jiaoren served as the Minister of Agriculture and Forestry.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本东京的著名私立大学，宋教仁曾在此留学。
description.en: A famous private university in Tokyo, Japan, where Song Jiaoren studied.

description.zh-cn: 位于日本东京的著名私立大学，宋教仁曾在此留学。
description.en: A famous private university in Tokyo, Japan, where Song Jiaoren studied.

description.zh-cn: 位于武昌的由美国圣公会创办的学校，宋教仁曾在此就读。
description.en: A school in Wuchang founded by the American Episcopal Church, where Song Jiaoren studied.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁遇刺的地点。
description.en: The location where Song Jiaoren was assassinated.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁的妻子。
description.en: Wife of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁的独子。
description.en: The only son of Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 华兴会共同创始人之一。
description.en: One of the co-founders of the Huaxinghui.

description.zh-cn: 华兴会共同创始人之一，革命宣传家。
description.en: One of the co-founders of the Huaxinghui and a revolutionary propagandist.

description.zh-cn: 华兴会共同创始人之一。
description.en: One of the co-founders of the Huaxinghui.

description.zh-cn: 清末新军第六镇统制，革命党人，后被袁世凯派人刺杀。
description.en: Commander of the 6th Division of the New Army in the late Qing Dynasty, a revolutionary, who was later assassinated by order of Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 清末宗社党首领，被革命党人彭家珍刺杀，有观点认为袁世凯是幕后策划者。
description.en: Leader of the Royalist Party in the late Qing Dynasty, assassinated by the revolutionary Peng Jiazhen, with some believing Yuan Shikai was the mastermind.

description.zh-cn: 民主革命家，公开斥责袁世凯刺杀宋教仁后，被毒杀于宴席上。
description.en: A democratic revolutionary who was poisoned at a banquet after publicly denouncing Yuan Shikai for assassinating Song Jiaoren.

description.zh-cn: 近代著名军事家，曾遭遇袁世凯派遣的刺客暗杀但幸免于难。
description.en: A famous modern military strategist who survived an assassination attempt by assassins sent by Yuan Shikai.

description.zh-cn: 北洋政府时期的军事执法机构，其侦探刺杀了应桂馨。
description.en: A military law enforcement agency during the Beiyang Government period, whose detectives assassinated Ying Guixin.

description.zh-cn: 中华民国建国初期由北洋军阀控制的中央政府。
description.en: The central government of the Republic of China in its early years, controlled by the Beiyang warlords.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁与黄兴、刘揆一、陈天华、章士钊等人共同成立华兴会。
description.en: Song Jiaoren co-founded the Huaxinghui with Huang Xing, Liu Kuiyi, Chen Tianhua, Zhang Shizhao, and others.

description.zh-cn: 在华兴会中，宋教仁担任副会长，会长为黄兴。
description.en: In the Huaxinghui, Song Jiaoren served as Vice President under President Huang Xing.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁支持孙中山成立中国同盟会，并担任司法部检事长。
description.en: Song Jiaoren supported Sun Yat-sen in establishing the Tongmenghui and served as the Procurator of its Judicial Department.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁是国民党的主要筹建人，主持了同盟会的改组工作。
description.en: Song Jiaoren was the main founder of the Kuomintang, presiding over the reorganization of the Tongmenghui.

description.zh-cn: 1903年8月，宋教仁与黄兴在武昌相识，从此成为挚友。
description.en: In August 1903, Song Jiaoren and Huang Xing met in Wuchang and became close friends thereafter.

description.zh-cn: 因对孙中山处理国旗及军火购买等事宜产生误会和不满，宋教仁产生恶感，并参与了第一次倒孙高潮。
description.en: Due to misunderstandings and dissatisfaction with Sun Yat-sen's handling of the national flag and arms procurement issues, Song Jiaoren developed animosity and participated in the first wave of anti-Sun movements.

description.zh-cn: 在国民党成立大会上，唐群英因党纲中没有“男女平权”而质问宋教仁，并掌击其脸颊。
description.en: At the founding meeting of the Kuomintang, Tang Qunying questioned Song Jiaoren about the absence of 'gender equality' in the party platform and slapped his cheeks.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁倡导的责任内阁制威胁到袁世凯的统治地位，袁世凯被广泛认为是刺杀宋教仁的幕后主使。
description.en: The cabinet responsibility system advocated by Song Jiaoren threatened Yuan Shikai's ruling position, and Yuan is widely believed to be the mastermind behind Song's assassination.

description.zh-cn: 时任国务总理赵秉钧被认为是直接布置暗杀宋教仁的执行者。
description.en: Then Premier Zhao Bingjun is considered to have been the direct organizer of Song Jiaoren's assassination.

description.zh-cn: 作为赵秉钧的秘书，洪述祖通过电报“毁宋酬勋”具体安排了刺杀行动。
description.en: As Zhao Bingjun's secretary, Hong Shuzu specifically arranged the assassination through the telegram 'destroy Song for a reward'.

description.zh-cn: 受洪述祖指使，雇佣武士英在上海北站刺杀了宋教仁。
description.en: Under instructions from Hong Shuzu, he hired Wu Shiying to assassinate Song Jiaoren at Shanghai North Railway Station.

description.zh-cn: 在上海北站开枪射杀宋教仁的直接凶手。
description.en: The direct assassin who shot Song Jiaoren at Shanghai North Railway Station.

description.zh-cn: 部分观点（如北一辉、袁克文等）认为，由于国民党内部的权力斗争，陈其美是刺杀宋教仁的幕后主使之一。
description.en: Some theories (e.g., from Kita Ikki, Yuan Kewen) suggest that due to internal power struggles within the Kuomintang, Chen Qimei was one of the masterminds behind Song Jiaoren's assassination.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁遇刺身亡是二次革命爆发的直接导火索。
description.en: The death of Song Jiaoren after his assassination was the direct trigger for the Second Revolution.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁死后，孙中山果断发动了二次革命以武力反袁。
description.en: After Song Jiaoren's death, Sun Yat-sen decisively launched the Second Revolution to oppose Yuan Shikai by force.

description.zh-cn: 与孙中山主张武力反袁不同，黄兴全力反对在宋案后立即使用武力。
description.en: Unlike Sun Yat-sen who advocated for armed opposition to Yuan, Huang Xing strongly opposed the immediate use of force after the Song case.

description.zh-cn: 宋教仁是中华民国初期第一位倡导并极力推广责任内阁制的政治家。
description.en: Song Jiaoren was the first politician in the early Republic of China to advocate for and vigorously promote the cabinet responsibility system.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯通过段祺瑞买凶，刺杀了北洋第六镇统制吴禄贞。
description.en: Yuan Shikai hired assassins through Duan Qirui to kill Wu Luzhen, the commander of the 6th Division of the Beiyang Army.

description.zh-cn: 袁世凯通过汪精卫和黄复生，指使彭家珍刺杀了其政敌良弼。
description.en: Yuan Shikai, through Wang Jingwei and Huang Fusheng, instructed Peng Jiazhen to assassinate his political rival Liangbi.

description.zh-cn: 在公开斥责袁世凯刺宋后，林述庆在袁世凯秘书长梁士诒的宴席上被毒死。
description.en: After publicly denouncing Yuan Shikai for assassinating Song, Lin Shuqing was poisoned at a banquet hosted by Yuan's chief secretary Liang Shiyi.

description.zh-cn: 为替袁世凯掩盖罪证，京畿军政执法处的侦探在火车上将应桂馨刺死灭口。
description.en: To cover up evidence for Yuan Shikai, detectives from the Capital's Military and Political Law Enforcement Office assassinated Ying Guixin on a train to silence him.

description.zh-cn: 1919年，洪述祖被北洋政府大理院以杀人罪判处死刑，并执行绞刑。
description.en: In 1919, Hong Shuzu was sentenced to death for murder by the Supreme Court of the Beiyang Government and was executed by hanging.
